column4: hi, i have a question. now that we have an actual choice, would you choose using ntfs over fat for a partition to be used by ubuntu and windows, or stick to the good old fat?
I suggest NTFS... more secure than fat
you can use ext3(linux files system) with windows using Ext2IFS utility , but it is not working 100%
I've also heard that that software isn't 100% safe with data
No it is safe... but sometimes you won't be able to delete some files and have to reboot to linux to delete them , which of course may be forgotten and may get you in trouble ;)
what size is that fat partition?
it's currently 40gig, but i might be growing it by 15 or so some time soon
formated in FAT???... I don't think so
well I can't recall what max size FAT fs could be... but I doubt it is 40 (forty gigs)
anyway... since it is 40 gigs, move to NTFS... for more security and better space utilization
okie doke, i'll see to it
it depends on your patience while searching google... my patience led me to Ext2IFS... go ahead and light me :)
hehe, i'm more inclined to just do the easy thing and use ntfs :s
before ntfs-3g Fat was prefered... but now you can read/write to NTFS under ubuntu... so why not?
